info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 3:03PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN JACKSON AND SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN PARISHES THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 303 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ruston, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruston, Grambling, Choudrant, and Quitman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
